body: I tested this with a forked qTox in a call with myself, and it seems to work fine. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/464)

comment_data.body: Add space before `(` in all `if` statements.
Add documentation. Also, this function should probably test for validity, not for invalidity. Also, it needs a toxav namespace prefix.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -628,6 +628,18 @@ int toxav_join_av_groupchat(Tox *tox, int32_t friendnumber, const uint8_t *data,
 int toxav_group_send_audio(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, const int16_t *pcm, unsigned int samples, uint8_t channels,
                            unsigned int sample_rate);
 
+
+/**
+ * Sets the Opus bit rate for a group call.
+ *
+ * return 0 on success.
+ * return -1 on failure.
+ */
+
+int toxav_group_bit_rate_set(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, int32_t audio_bit_rate);
+
+bool audio_bit_rate_invalid(uint32_t bit_rate);

comment_data.body: How did you decide to make audio_bit_rate a signed int32_t?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -628,6 +628,18 @@ int toxav_join_av_groupchat(Tox *tox, int32_t friendnumber, const uint8_t *data,
 int toxav_group_send_audio(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, const int16_t *pcm, unsigned int samples, uint8_t channels,
                            unsigned int sample_rate);
 
+
+/**
+ * Sets the Opus bit rate for a group call.
+ *
+ * return 0 on success.
+ * return -1 on failure.
+ */
+
+int toxav_group_bit_rate_set(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, int32_t audio_bit_rate);

comment_data.body: I made it signed because I modeled the template for the function call off of toxav_bit_rate_set.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -628,6 +628,18 @@ int toxav_join_av_groupchat(Tox *tox, int32_t friendnumber, const uint8_t *data,
 int toxav_group_send_audio(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, const int16_t *pcm, unsigned int samples, uint8_t channels,
                            unsigned int sample_rate);
 
+
+/**
+ * Sets the Opus bit rate for a group call.
+ *
+ * return 0 on success.
+ * return -1 on failure.
+ */
+
+int toxav_group_bit_rate_set(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, int32_t audio_bit_rate);

comment_data.body: The audio_bit_rate_invalid function existed before I forked it, I just made defined it in the header so I can reference it in the groupav.c file. I'm changing the header version to be toxav_audio_bit_rate_valid
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -628,6 +628,18 @@ int toxav_join_av_groupchat(Tox *tox, int32_t friendnumber, const uint8_t *data,
 int toxav_group_send_audio(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, const int16_t *pcm, unsigned int samples, uint8_t channels,
                            unsigned int sample_rate);
 
+
+/**
+ * Sets the Opus bit rate for a group call.
+ *
+ * return 0 on success.
+ * return -1 on failure.
+ */
+
+int toxav_group_bit_rate_set(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, int32_t audio_bit_rate);
+
+bool audio_bit_rate_invalid(uint32_t bit_rate);

comment_data.body: I see, toxav_call and toxav_bit_rate_set are inconsistent. Can you make it unsigned? There are no negative bit rates.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -628,6 +628,18 @@ int toxav_join_av_groupchat(Tox *tox, int32_t friendnumber, const uint8_t *data,

                            unsigned int sample_rate);

+ * return 0 on success.

comment_data.body: Ok, let me know when the change is done.

comment_data.body: All of the changes were applied, but my fork fell out of date. I'll apply this to the newer version
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -628,6 +628,18 @@ int toxav_join_av_groupchat(Tox *tox, int32_t friendnumber, const uint8_t *data,
 int toxav_group_send_audio(Tox *tox, int groupnumber, const int16_t *pcm, unsigned int samples, uint8_t channels,
                            unsigned int sample_rate);

+ * return 0 on success.
+ * return -1 on failure.

+
+bool audio_bit_rate_invalid(uint32_t bit_rate);

comment_regular_data.body: Turns out this works fine with two people, but three or more still experience a lot of audio loss
The group call issue was a client problem. It appears this works fine and also allows for on the fly changing of values.

*[toxav/groupav.h, line 27 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/464#-Kcconkdt7KxeXPG-IUy:-KcconkerB3K59JsnJYF:b-wyrh4a) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cc4ea69dc238bac5beb80ab23d5bb1e0a8938ba5/toxav/groupav.h#L27)):*
> ```objc
> #define GROUP_AUDIO_PACKET_ID 192
> 
> #define INVALID_AUDIO_BITRATE(a) (a < 6 || a > 510)
> ```

Having both, this define and the function is dangerous, because they have to be kept in sync, is there a way to define this only once?
Additionally I think there should be getter functions for the min and max bitrates.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/464)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->
Ill see what i can do

I added min and max getters for group audio bit rate (min and max are defined as min and max per the Opus spec), rebased my fork against the latest commit on the main branch, and fixed all problems raised so far that I could see.

Just want to note that this PR [doesn't pass the format test](https://travis-ci.org/TokTok/c-toxcore/jobs/208031049#L2450-L2556).

Please [astyle](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/tree/master/other/astyle) your code. Also make sure not to edit `toxav.h` directly. `toxav.h` must be generated off `toxav.api.h` using [APIDSL](https://github.com/TokTok/apidsl).

Reviewed 2 of 7 files at r3.

*[toxav/groupav.c, line 551 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/464#-KhaUAjNAhzbwvmXnhNc:-KhaUAjNAhzbwvmXnhNd:b-96u1pz) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/bb3cc2defd04122c11e7ce7cb7f97e368088117c/toxav/groupav.c#L551)):*
> ```C
>         group_av->audio_bitrate = audio_bit_rate * 1000;
> 
>         if (recreate_encoder(group_av) == -1) {
> ```

If this fails, the group_av->audio_bitrate will remain set on a new value so it can cause problems in future retries.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/464)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

I've requested a change.

More explanation: The reconfiguration is quite tricky, if it fails you've lost your good encoder without a way of falling back. I propose a use of create_audio_encoder() function as seen in audio.c

---

*[toxav/toxav.c, line 1010 at r5](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/464#-KwS8YVScvF5JKkUbGzM:-KwS8YVScvF5JKkUbGzN:bj5ywmh) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/68a5aa1233ca23fffde15df5665a5edcc46d0236/toxav/toxav.c#L1010)):*
> ```C
>      * Opus supports all bit rates from 6 kbit/s to 510 kbit/s.
>      */
>     return bit_rate < 6 || bit_rate > 510;
> ```

All places in the code where the min and max bit rates are used should use the new functions. These constants should appear in the code exactly once.

---

*[toxav/toxav.c, line 1014 at r5](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/464#-KwS8nv5XPbvYLVIi_sV:-KwS8nv5XPbvYLVIi_sW:boibw3z) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/68a5aa1233ca23fffde15df5665a5edcc46d0236/toxav/toxav.c#L1014)):*
> ```C
> bool toxav_audio_bit_rate_valid(uint32_t bit_rate)
> {
>     return !audio_bit_rate_invalid(bit_rate);
> ```

This looks weird. You should probably change the `audio_bit_rate_invalid` function to check if the bit rate's valid instead.

title: added toxav_group_bit_rate_set
